DataElement.preferredName: Healthcare Encounter Dictionary or Standardized Term
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dictionary or standardized text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY), if applicable, as defined by the sponsor.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Healthcare Encounters Dictionary-derived Term Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A healthcare encounter identifier obtained from a dictionary._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: A healthcare encounter identifier obtained from a dictionary.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/26/20 Created to support sponsor defined codelists; tmt.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 07.14.22_Released during quarterly metrics and per request from G. Riley_ghd

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, and GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE - PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE - HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.

ReferenceDocuments.name: HODECOD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 07.14.22_Released as part of the quarterly metrics and per request of G. Riley_ghd
